oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-07-21 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 21, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer - although Ernest Tubb was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show) with Jimmie Selph, guest performer Rose Maddox, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Morgan; Rod Brasfield; Rose Maddox; Lew Childre; Jimmie Selph
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces George Morgan -- Tennessee Central No. 9 (George Morgan) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, George Morgan) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces Rose Maddox -- Hey Little Dreamboat (Rose Maddox) -- George Morgan introduces Lew Childre -- Old Joe Clark (Lew Childre calls) -- George Morgan talks -- Jesus, Savior, Pilot Me (George Morgan, Jimmie Selph) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- Prince Albert jingle [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Selph, Jimmy; Robinson, Floyd; Maddox, Rose; Morgan, George, 1925-1975
